ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: You learn the basics of Spanish grammar, including writing, speaking, and listening.
I was able to challenge myself more and get out of my comfort zone through the activities in class and outside of class.
This course is a great foundation for Spanish! I went from knowing no Spanish to being able to speak for 5 minutes and write 2-page essays by the end of the semester!
I am on the right track to fluency in this language because of this course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: As goes for every other language course at Yale College, this class was very fast paced. Coming out of high school where I learned and studied a language for four years, it was difficult to keep up with the pace of this course. However, the activities and assignments were engaging and made sure that the student will actually learn and get something out of it.
This course is very engaging and teaches a lot of grammar and vocabulary. I wish there was more of a focus on culture, but that is a small gripe considering the importance of learning the language.
This course was a little fast paced but this may be necessary to build fluency. Strengths include the engagement with the language during the class.

This is a very rigorous course and you learn a lot. Very fast-paced and difficult when coming into the class with no knowledge of the language -- the expectation of only using and speaking Spanish a few weeks into the semester prevents students from getting to know each other and becoming friends.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!! Professor Vzquez was amazing and I learned a lot in the class and really enjoyed it. It's honestly not that much work (~ 1 hour/night) and is usually enjoyable and relevant to the class. I took this class as a senior just trying to take a fun class and would highly recommend it as a great way to learn the basics of Spanish and learn more about the Spanish speaking countries of the world.
I definitely recommend this class. The instructor is very hands on and really cares about the students ability to learn the language and the cultures behind it.
Yes! Take it if you want to learn about Spanish!
Yes, very engaging course that improved my written and spoken skills of Spanish.
Yes if you need to learn a language! Spanish is useful.
